runs.comm: and his drought continues as he clips this swinging delivery on middle right to silly mid-on, who throws himself onto it
and he finally gets away this World Cup with a nice glide through third man to this one leaving him from a length on off stump
overpitched outside of off and all Shehzad has to do is lean into a drive through the covers
looking for a yorker but gets his line wrong as he slips this wide of the batsman
another one following the same line as before, but this time is not punished by the umpire as it just stays inside the margin
closer to the batsman now, but still too full, as this goes across Nasir to the keeper
finishes with a peach of an inswinging delivery that bursts through the gap between his drive and the off stump. Tailed back just enough to almost kiss the stump, but doesn't do any damage in the end
on the money straightaway as he targets the pads with this fullish length ducking into leg stump. Clipped by Shehzad in the end to the leg side
short of a length, with some bounce, as this goes across Shehzad, who looks to punch this away through the covers, but it was more of a tentative poke really
finds a lovely line outside off, with the length perfect as this tails in to the batsman, who defends it away to the off side
continues to operate in a similar channel as Shehzad fends this away
far too short as this didn't seem to bounce as high as expected. Shehzad is able to whip this off the pads with a jump, but can't locate any space on the on side
far too short as Shehzad is able to get back and pull this through midwicket to find the first boundary of the day. Gave this everything as he crunched this
pitched right up to Jamshed on middle and leg, who is able to drive it away to the leg side
looking to pierce the gap through cover with a push, but finds short mid-off
length delivery on middle and off which is defended off the back foot to the bowler

waits on this length delivery on the pads before tucking it away towards square-leg, with the man at short midwicket getting some part of his hand on it to take most of the pace away, but can't prevent the run in the end
defended by the batsman towards the leg side
full, swinging delivery which is nailed straight to mid-off as he got low on one knee
length delivery which is defended off the back foot by Nasir
slower ball, and a touch shorter on a middle to off line, as Nasir is able to flick this away through to deep midwicket. Very wristy work there by Nasir

for the third time in four innings, Nasir has to tuck his bat under his arm and head to the pavilion after yet another mistimed pull gets him into trouble. Was not at all in control of this as he looked to deposit this slightly short delivery over midwicket, but ends up bottom-edging it high to the fielder on the ring, who is able to take it quite comfortably
gets through his first delivery by defending this length delivery away to the off side
gets forward a touch to negotiate this fuller delivery outside off towards the covers
presents an angled face to this one delivered on an off stump line from the left-armer
allows this one to leave him outside off to the keeper
another beauty just outside off and angling in as Shehzad shows keen awareness of his off stump
draws him forward with a tentative defensive stroke off the back foot, with the ball just nibbling away after pitching on a length. The front foot was stationary as he fished slightly for the ball
fuller one just outside off and allowed to sail through to the keeper
full delivery on middle and leg which is driven straight to the mid-on fielder
slightly wider on a fullish length which is worked away by Shehzad towards cover, as he is able to get to the other end
angling away well outside off, Shehzad leaves it alone
squares up Shehzad with this one tapering away on a middle to off-stump line
far too leg-side as Shehzad is able to glance this away through midwicket for a hurried single
fullish length on middle and leg which is nurdled straight to mid-on, with the batsman intending to get it more towards midwicket
a misfield at square-leg releases some pressure as Sohail is off the mark to this fuller one outside off which is re-directed by the left-hander
eases away this length delivery off the back foot towards gully  to end the over
length outside off which is defended off the back foot with a nice, high elbow
gets wonderful carry to this short of a length delivery wide of off which just leaps away from the flashing blade of Shehzad, who looked to slice this over point
short of a length and angling into Shehzad as he gets nice and tall to counter
this time is able to get up and under to glide this away through third man
short of a length which slants across the left-hander as he fends it away just behind square on the off side
thuds into the thigh pad of Haris as he fails to clip this short of a length off the hips
fullish length which is treated with a defensive push to the off side

dropped fantastic effort from Khurram Khan at extra-cover as Shehzad, who is looking to break the shackles somewhat, comes down the track to try and blitz Guruge through the covers, but ends up almost getting caught by the fielder at extra-cover, who has to dive to his left to try and get a hand on it. Ends up falling away after getting his left hand on it initially
Shehzad gets himself off the hot seat by working away this next one to point for a single
Sohail gets his first boundary by slogging against the line to this length delivery slanting on middle and leg. This ends up at the midwicket boundary after a couple of bounces
looks to time one off the back foot through the covers, but picks out one of the fielders
turned away to the leg side for a single to keep the strike
full delivery, going across Haris, as this just flies by. Quite a pacey delivery in the end
a touch wider now as this time Sohail is able to drive it, but picks out the man at point
picks the gap at extra-cover with a classy back-foot cover drive, but doesn't quite get the timing he sought

dropped UAE gives Shehzad a life as he attacks this fullish length outside off with a blazing drive that flies straight to point at a catch-able height, but ends up dropping it after getting it in his hands on the first go. Big let-off for Shehzad, who has not yet reached top gear
angling away in the channel outside off, Sohail leaves it alone
and now Haris gets away with a risky stroke outside off that catches the outside edge before flying through the vacant gap at second/third slip to find the third man boundary
strays on the pads and is punished with a deft flick which runs away to the fine leg boundary

almost curtains for Shehzad as he flicks away this fuller delivery off the pads, but just inches short off short backward square who was placed for the trap. Shehzad notices after and punches his bat in furstration
leaves this one swinging away well wide of off, which is ultimately called wide by the umpire
slips down the leg-side once more as Shehzad makes a rash effort of trying to get willow on ball
plants his foot before defending this length delivery going across him
driven straight to mid-on by Shehzad

uses his feet well to get down and hoick away the left-armer over extra-cover, with this threatening to just touch the rope after slowing down in the deep. The fielder at mid-off is able to run it down and just about get his fingers on it to try and stop this mere millimetres from the rope, but his efforts are dashed after replays show contact was made
slower ball which Shehzad sees late enough to edge away with soft hands, but can't beat the slipper who was aware of his intentions
opens the face to run this length delivery down to third man
short of a length which is guided away to third man by Sohail
Shehzad looking to club this back of a length over midwicket, but almost spoons a catch to mid-on, with this falling a few feet short of the fielder
comes down the track before having to readjust tactics and reach out to this wide yorker from Naveed, which he manages to do in the end
in the slot but Shehzad ends up lacing this one straight to deep cover
short of a length which is tucked away to the leg side by Haris for one
lets loose a full swinging attempted yorker on middle which is flicked away hurriedly by Sohail through backward square
better now from Javed, pitching on and about off, as this is defended by the batsman
delivers this one well down the leg side as the umpire gets to stretch his arms
overpitched and all Haris has to do is lean into this to drive it away through long off. The fielder at mid-off ended up escorting this down to the boundary as he chased after in vain
fuller one slipping down leg which Haris fails to flick away behind square

goes round the wicket now, delivering one on a back of a length and slanting down as Javed is certainly suffering some nerves as he gives Haris an opportunity to tickle this one away through fine leg to beat the fielder at deep backward square to the boundary
continues from the same line as this one is tucked away to the leg side by Haris
gets a nice stride in to push this one away to the off side
lobs up one which turns in from outside off as the batsman nurdles it away through the leg side
goes round the wicket to the left-hander as this one is defended on the front foot by Haris
darts one in on a slightly fuller line now as this is negotiated safely by the batsman
advances down to needle this away to deep extra-cover to rotate strike. Also brings up their fifty-run stand as well
continues over the wicket to Shehzad who is able to get on the back foot and defend away Tauqur
bissects the gap at point with a punch through the off side, but is restricted to just the two after the ball eases up in the deep
continues round the wicket to Haris as this one angles in with the line before being defended away to the leg side
fuller now on the same channel as this is drilled straight to mid-off
short of a length which is fended away by Haris, who then rushes to the other end when he sees Shehzad haring for the striker's
lovely away swinging delivery which is not tampered with by the batsman
fuller now, in the same channel, as this is driven hesitantly towards mid-off
short and edging onto the pads as this is glanced behind of square for a single
tries to guide this one off the back foot past a sprawling Tauqir, but is thwarted once mid-on enters the fray
this time able to force it past the bowler to find long on
darted in on middle and leg as this is tucked away towards long on
acrobatic stop at mid-on to this one directed away by Shehzad. Amjad Ali was the fielder there as he finished with a roll
defended away to the off side by the right-hander
driven firmly by Shehzad towards deep extra-cover, urging his partner to make it back for the second, which they end up doing quite comfortably
begins from round the wicket as Sohail gets forward to defend the line
looks to force one away through the off side, but ends up chipping uppishly towards long off in the end
works with the angle to turn this away off the pads on the leg side
lovely swinging delivery which leaves the batsman as he gets forward before electing to leave it
looking to guide this one past point, but the fielder is equal to the task
down the pitch and lifts Javed high over his head to find the long on boundary with aplomb. Struck that well enough to just get this over the rope. That will help Pakistan's runrate!
gets deep in his crease to try and work this one drifting on the pads, behind square
this time negotiated away to the off side
able to scamper a single through midwicket as Haris initially looked for two, before the powerful throw dissuaded that notion
dabs this one away down to long on for one
gets down the track a touch before nudging this one away to the leg side
able to pull off the short-arm jab through long off/long on to get to the other end
defended at the top of the bounce by Haris Sohail
given room to drive this away in front of point through the off side
looks to blitz this one square off the wicket, but finds point in a hurry

tries once more to cut away the fast bowler through point, with the fielder taking off most of the pace with a dive, but is unable to stop this fully as it continues behind with a deviated path towards deep cover
waits on the back foot to try and run this one behind of square on the off side
full and in the slot as this is driven firmly down to deep extra-cover
drawn forward to defend this one darted in on middle and off
flighted a touch as this one is worked back to the bowler in his follow through
tries to force this past Tauqir on the leg-side, but is held by the bowler
tucked away through long on now as Haris wanted two, but Shehzad didn't seem so inclined

the scoop comes out for the first time as he looks to paddle this away through fine leg. The fielder in the deep is slow on the pickup and throw which allows time for Shehzad to get back for the second
punched away off the back foot to the left of Tauqir, who puts in a fine dive to stop this in its tracks
continues from round the wicket as this one is defended on the front foot
looks to blaze one away on the up through backward point, but is thwarted in his attempt by said fielder
this time looking to drive through long on, but is cut off by the mid-on fielder
nudged away to the leg side, but can't get it past the close-in fielder
goes down the track a touch before working away Amjad through backward point, but is stopped by the fielder
dabs this back of a length down to third man to end the over
flighted on off, Sohail comes down the track and eases it to long on
flatter and on off stump, Shehzad punches it to extra-cover as he backed away to give himself room
huge shout for lbw, but umpire Ravi says not-out. Shehzad kneels down the wicket, misses the sweep,
gets away a single through mid-on to rotate the strike
able to hammer away a boundary square off the wicket to find the rope in a hurry. Timely boundary for Pakistan
finishes off the over with a gentle clip down to long on
begins with one going down the leg side which is tickled away by the batsman behind of square
punched away off the back foot down to long on
defended with a slightly angled face by Shehzad
backs away to the right to try and force this away through the covers, but is unsuccessful in his attempt
presents a dead, straight bat to the bowler
glances this one away to the leg side, but can't pinch the single
quicker and around off, Sohail stands tall and punches it towards cover
comes down the track and turns it towards midwicket, with the fielder keeping his calm
cut away to the off side as they steal the single
works it with the turn to the right of midwicket for a comfortable single
picks up a straightforward single though long on to get to the other end
defended by the batsman to see out the over
nurdled away to the man at the deep at long on
given plenty of flight as this is directed away to the man at long on for Shehzad to register a first World Cup fifty
driven back to the bowler in his follow through after he looked to adjust his stroke
gets away with an outside edge that is fielded by the deep slip
this time driven away through mid-off for one
able to get deep and cut this away through the covers for a brace
backs away and gets deep before getting a bottom-edge to this attempt cut through the covers. Looked like he rushed the stroke to get it streaking away through backward square
defended by the batsman
jabbed away to the short mid-off fielder

looks to pull this one all the way to the midwicket boundary, but the man at cow corner is able to come round to field the ball. Brings up Sohail's first World Cup fifty as well, not to mention the 100-run partnership as well
eases away this one darted in to long on

connects beautifully with this one floated in just outside off, but is stopped by a fine dive by the man at cover, who is able to get most of his body behind the ball before re-directing it towards the point region
drags the length a touch which Shehzad sees early enough to slog this away through cow corner for four
a simple tap-and-run outside his off stump gets him to the other end
flighted on middle and leg as this is eased away to long on
driven comfortably by the batsman to long off to rotate the strike
punched straight back to the bowler in his follow through
gets down the track and bludgeons Khurram over long on, hitting this effectively with the spin to get this sailng over the rope. Met with plenty of enthusiasm from the Pakistani ranks in the crowd
looks to cut away this one floated in outside off, but the shot was never really on as the length was far too full
this time defended back to the bowler, who picks it up in his follow through
driven away now towards the fielder at long off for one
worked away with the greatest of ease through the off side as they canter another run
some aggression now, but just to chip this over short midwicket, as the ball is ended up fielded by long on
comes down before blocking this one effectively past the bowler to his left to get to the other end
begins with a nice loosener which wobbles a bit as it is delivered on middle and leg, with this one eased away to the leg side with a clip
fullish length which shapes away as Haris works this away towards backward point
able to steal a run on the off side with a push as he hares to the other end in time of the throw
waits on the back foot to try and run this one past the keeper, who is standing up behind the stumps, but is late on it
gets on top of this before jabbing away towards the off side
straying down the pads as he gets away an uppish flick through square-leg

invited to come down the track as he lifts the bowler over cow corner, with this looking to be picked up quite easily by the man at the deep, before he suffers a horrible brain fade as he fails to pick up the ball on the first instance, with this having enough legs behind it to just get to the rope thereafter. Needless boundary there for UAE, but welcomed all the same by the boys in green
defended by the batsman
tries to give himself room square off the wicket, but ends up picking out backward point
bends his front knee and heaves it towards midwicket. The fielder dives to his right and makes a fine stop
backs away a whole lot, with the bounce outdoing him here as he looked for his favoured cut through the covers
is very late on this attempt sweep down the leg side, as the umpire calls a wide
this time gets away Tauqir through the leg-side with a glance
tucked away to the leg side, but can't pinch a single
slightly squares up the batsman with this leg-side slanting delivery as the ball pops up initially from the bat, falling slightly short of the bowler in his follow through
gets well over to the off side to try and maneuver this shortish length over fine leg with a paddle, which he just gets away past short backward square to find the boundary
this time glides away the bowler through third man, giving the first run his very best to come back for three in the end
blazes away on the up through the covers to find deep cover in a hurry
driven away through to extra-cover, but hits it a bit too well to the fielder to prevent the quick single
worked away through midwicket for one
some improvisation from Shehzad as he finds the gap to this fuller one floated in by the captain to paddle this through the gap between short fine leg and backward square
this time sweeps towards deep midwicket to get Haris on strike
tucked away to the leg side for a single
punched away to the off side now for one
drags this one as Sohail advances a couple of steps before belting this down rashly to long on

gives this one some welly as he clubs away the medium pacer through the line to find the deep midwicket boundary. Also gets them past their 150-run partnership, which surely must be one of the highest they have mustered in this tournament, if not the highest?
turned away now to the leg side for a straightforward, and rather sensible, single
slower ball which the batsman waits on before carting away to the man at long on
backs away a touch before lifting the bowler to place this near the man at deep extra-cover
fullish length ducking into the pads as this is clipped away through mid-on
slower delivery on middle and leg which is punched away off the back foot, but straight to the man at cover
able to execute the tip-and-run outside off to perfection as Sohail gets to the other end in a flash
looks to slam Naveed out of North Island as he lets go a big swing of the bat through the line to this shorter delivery going across
this time makes a connection to find a single on the off side
stand and deliver as he slices this fuller one high over cover point towards the deep

Haris, looking to bludgeon Naveed over long on, ends up mishitting this one completely to lob up a chance to the man at mid-on, who doesn't have to move to far off his mark to pluck this in the air. Quite a soft ending to what was looking a promising knock from the left-hander
back of a length delivery just outside off. Maqsood shuffles across and wrists it towards midwicket, where the fielder moves to his left to stop the ball
eases away this gentle medium pace through to long on
length delivery which is guided away by the batsman to the leg side
able to glide this one away off the back foot square off the wicket
gets away a chip through midwicket to pickup a single
strikes this length delivery crisply, but straight to the man at cover

slower delivery which is read by Maqsood as he lifts the bowler ever so elegantly over long off, running the first one hard to come back for the second. Some lax fielding in the deep may have assisted in that too...

short of a length outside of off which is cut away just behind square. The pair run hard to come back for the second, with a low, flat throw from the man at deep backward point doing enough to rush the batsman into a dive, but it looks like he may have just got home here. Wait a minute though, Shehzad, who is in the 90s, has turned his bat as he attempts to make his ground at the striker's end. It looks like it may have bounced, with the bat failing to ground itself on the all-important white crease. He won't like the end decision, but he has to go. Unfortunate end to what most likely looked like a first World Cup century from a Pakistan bat this tournament
and he is able to negotiate the first ball as he gets his bat down to this fuller length before directing it away through mid-off for a single
short of a length and angling in as this is defended from the depth of the crease
tries to force the issue on the off side, but is unable to get this away
gets in a small stride before fending away this fullish length to the leg side
another delivery on the shorter side which is handled with ease as he plays at it with soft hands
looks to get away a run through point before sloppy backing up from Krishna allows the extra-run as the ball is eventually fielded at cow corner
gets away a run through square-leg to bring Maqsood on strike
slower ball outside of off which Maqsood tries to wrist away through point, but is thwarted by said fielder
whips away this fuller length off the pads to pickup a run on the leg side
fuller delivery which is needled past the bowler, who puts in an ineffectual dive after-the-fact
another slower delivery which is waited on by Maqsood before drilling it straight to deep extra-cover
poor delivery well wide of off which Amjad gets away with as Maqsood stood tall to reach out and try and get this past the man at the boundary in the deep. Held to just two in the end
this time strays on the pads as Maqsood whips away the delivery, but straight to the close-in fielder on the leg side

marginally short and Maqsood latches onto it, getting onto the back foot to pull this uppishly over midwicket. Only just got it over the fielder as the ball continued on to make its way to the boundary rope
slower delivery, swinging away outside off, as Maqsood gets bat on ball to nail this through the covers
glanced away towards the fielder at square-leg, with the man doing enough to deter the notion of a second from the batsman's mind
driven handsomely on the up through the covers, but doesn't penetrate the gap as he would have liked as the fielder out deep is able to come round to field the ball
slower ball which Misbah waits on as he defends with soft hands
punched away off the back foot, but straight to short cover
short from Krishna as Misbah rocks back to pull this aerially through midwicket, getting this comfortably over short mid-on
this time fended away to the off side by the tuk tuk extraordinaire
clipped away down to long on to get Sohaib on strike
slower delivery which Maqsood tries to late cut, but ends up finding short third man in a hurry as it arrives to him after a couple of bounces
negotiated to the leg side by Misbah, and with ever so delicate hands at that
glides this through the vacant space to find third man at the boundary
full delivery which drifts on the toes as Maqsood, realising fine leg was up, is able to flick this expertly through the space to find the boundary in quick time
waits on it before opening the face to work this just behind square on the off side
another leg-side delivery which, if left alone would have been a wide anyways, but Maqsood recognises he can just get to this to deftly tickle it away through fine leg for four more

looking to draw him into the trap with short backward square in force, but offers up a loose delivery which Maqsood is able to get behind and angle past the fielder to make it consecutive boundaries through fine leg to end the over
wobbly dibbly-dobbler on middle and leg which is worked away to the leg side
steps over to the off side before getting on one knee to slam this high over cow corner in that trademark Misbah manner, but the ball doesn't have enough legs to reach the boundary
this time elects for the single down to long on to get to the other end
sliced away off the back foot to find the man at sweeper cover
short ball which Misbah looks to pummel over midwicket, but ends up hitting it straighter towards long on
slower delivery which is pushed back to the bowler in his follow through as he makes a vain attempt to try and get to it
straddling on the pads as Maqsood works with the inswing to glance this away to deep midwicket
shuffles over to the off side to try and turn this full delivery into a leg-side one, as this is turned away behind square for one
gets swing into the pads as this full delivery is drilled past the bowler to long on
fuller length, but slow, as Maqsood checks his shot as he leans into the drive to long off
looks to club away this fuller length over midwicket, but ends up getting it more towards square-leg in the end
shuffles again to the off side before clipping the bowler just in front of square through midwicket
struck away off the back foot, but straight to backward point
slow delivery, and short, as Misbah cuts away fiercely to the square boundary, with Khurram Khan doing well in the deep to cut off a certain boundary
this time in the slot for Misbah as he gets on one knee to hammer Krishna high and handsome over cow corner for a huge six. That one went away 90 metres!
and sensibly gets to the other end with a prod down to long off
wristy flick which is sent high over cow corner, with Rohan Mustafa, in the position, coming forward initially, but not enough to take the catch as it falls with a couple of bounces ahead of him

stand and deliver as Maqsood sends a personal message to Wasim Akram in the commentary box with a hefty blow that strikes the window of the media room. Sent this one high over long off to send a shiver down the former Pakistan left-armer's spine
shimmies a touch to the off side before looking to blitz over long on, but fails to make a connection
slightly slower on a similar line as Misbah checks his shot before resorting to dab this down through third man

overpitched delivery on middle and leg which is sent careening over backward square with a lovely flick of the wrists to just clear the boundary rope. Went as flat as a tack, but got the job done in the end
this time finds the blockhole as Misbah does well to dig this one out in the direction of long off

straight and sent the distance by Maqsood as he shows potential IPL suitors what he is capable off. Sends this slower ball into orbit before it descended back to land in the midwicket stand. Does enough to prompt an appearance of the silver box as another cherry is selected by the on-field officials

on the fourth attempt of his juggling act, Rohan Mustafa at backward point is able to snaffle the chance as an errant slice from Maqsood spells his demise. Played an important hand of 45 off 31 as Pakistan look to accelerate at the tail-end of this innings
tuk-tukked away to the man at long on to get Umar on strike
and straight away he is off the mark as he eases one down to long off
clipped down to long on for one
looks to glide this one past the man at backward point, but Rohan Mustafa is on a high, and is quick to it
this time fails to paddle away this leg-side delivery as a wide is called by the umpire
now goes for the unorthodox option as he pulls out the reverse sweep, but still can't get it past the short third man
this time picks his gap at fine leg as he sweeps this past the man in the circle to pickup four valuable runs
full and slipping down leg as this is clipped behind square
backs away before reverting to his original stance as he works this one down to long on for one
back of a length and nipping in as this is defended by Umar to the off side
full delivery which he utilises the inward angle on as he flicks this away uppishly through backward square to find the boundary. This one beat the man at deep fine leg to the rope

goes straight again as Umar fails to clip this off the pads as it seems to strike in line on the full. Naveed utters a half-hearted appeal for leg before, but is it not given by the umpire. After a brief discussion though, UAE decide to review. Replays show that the ball indeed was swinging past the leg stump when it had made impact, so the original decision stands
moves in his crease before angling this full delivery towards deep square-leg to retain the strike
defended by the batsman
poor delivery from Mustafa, he misses the yorker and dishes out a full toss, Misbah kneels down and plays the reverse sweep behind point. He placed it right between point and short third man
once again looks to reverse, except this time Rohan slips it down leg, beating not only the batsman, but the keeper as well
this time elects to go for the conventional sweep to this one slipping down leg, as he ends up getting a leg-bye behind past the keeper
this time finds the gap through fine leg with a powerful sweep
and now shows off his reverse one last time for the Napier crowd, but only succeeds in finding short third man
once again tries to force it past the man, except this time he is able to run the single to get to yet another fifty
eases away this low, full delivery towards long on
able to slice this one over the slips towards third man to pickup a brace

solid sound as this connected with the ball, as Umar sends this one soaring over cow corner, with the man in the stands pulling off a wonderful catch. Was right in the slot for him as he unleashed this 94-m monster
getting a touch carried away as he hammers again in the same general direction, but this time doesn't get it away as cleanly
full toss which is no-balled for height as Misbah works with the angle to hook this past short fine leg to earn Pakistan a bonus boundary
now clubs away this fullish length towards cow corner as the pair are able to run two, getting them past 300 for the first time in this tournament as well
hoicks this fuller one high over extra-cover to end a good over for Pakistan
delivers a low, full toss which is smashed away to the leg side for a quick single
able to guide this fuller delivery through the covers to find deep cover

dropped what is that, the third of the day now? another drop in the deep earns a Pakistan life as Akmal, looking to flick over square-leg, offers up a chance to the man in the deep, who gets forward before bobbling the chance at the last moment
eases away a single to the leg side to get Umar back on strike
able to get up and under to slice this full delivery over extra-cover, with the man at the boundary doing well to run this down
shuffles to the off side before re-directing this low, full delivery towards mid-on
waits on this before lifting it over to deep extra-cover for a brace
fuller length which is hammered to the man at long off, with the ball arriving to him after a couple of bounces

gets nicely under this full delivery on middle, which he gracefully flicks away aerially, but straight to the man at deep square-leg, who does well to catch this just steps from the boundary rope. Umar looked bewildered after realising his fortune, and departs the field soon after

shifts over to the off side, as he looked to clear the man at long on with another lusty blow, but this time he doesn't get enough under it as Rohan Mustafa, waiting in the deep, is able to take this, despite having to get down on one knee to support himself after. Ends another vital knock from the Pakistan captain, who did his best to get his team over the hump and into a formidable position
this time Afridi is able to get off the mark as he opens the face to just get this behind square before darting off to the other end

Riaz shows Afridi what needed to be done there as he clubs away Guruge high over midwicket to earn Pakistan six more. Looks like the man with the orange shirt may have also plucked this one-handed in the crowd, with replays confirming this soon after. He is in the money now!
Javed can now say he has been hit by Afridi in an international match, as Afridi gets to the 8000-run ODI mark with a slice high over deep cover to hit yet another half-dozen
Javed shows he has more to his arsenal as he slips in a yorker which Afridi is able to dig out
another yorker, this time just outside of off, as Afridi drills this straight to long off, running the first one hard enough to come back for the strike
overpitched, and well wide of off, as all Afridi has to do is free his arms to heave this over extra-cover for another maximum
bang, bang, bang, this time he only (yawns) gets a four with an aerial scythe over extra-cover to beat the boundary rider to the rope
full delivery on middle which Afridi looks to deposit over long on, but mistimes the strike as this lands inside of the rope, but not before they run two to get to 339
